Operation 'post-createPermit' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_summary: Create new permits linked to a recurring contract.
data.current_description: Create permits for a recurring contract, including support for defining restrictions.
data.description_suggestion: Creates new permits linked to a recurring contract with optional restriction definitions. Accepts a CreatePermitRequest containing the recurring contract reference and permit details. Returns a CreatePermitResult with the newly created permit reference and status. This operation enables merchants to establish payment authorization limits and conditions for recurring transactions.
data.reasoning: The current description is too brief and lacks critical details about inputs, outputs, and the operational context. Added clarity about what the operation accepts (CreatePermitRequest), what it returns (CreatePermitResult), and the business purpose (establishing authorization limits). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'post-disablePermit' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description is incomplete and lacks input/output details. Added clarity about the request schema (DisablePermitRequest), response schema (DisablePermitResult), and the operational effect (permit no longer valid for authorization). This enables AI agents to understand the full lifecycle of the operation.

data.current_description: Disable a permit that was previously linked to a recurringDetailReference.
data.description_suggestion: Disables an existing permit that was previously linked to a recurringDetailReference. Accepts a DisablePermitRequest containing the permit reference and related identifiers. Returns a DisablePermitResult confirming the permit has been disabled and is no longer valid for authorization. This operation prevents further use of the specified permit for recurring transactions.
data.reasoning: The current description is incomplete and lacks input/output details. message: Operation 'post-notifyShopper' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. The current description lacks input/output schema details and doesn't clearly explain what the operation returns or its regulatory context. Added clarity about the request schema (NotifyShopperRequest), response schema (NotifyShopperResult), and the regulatory purpose (Indian payment requirements). This helps AI agents understand the geographic and regulatory constraints of this operation.

data.current_summary: Ask issuer to notify the shopper
data.current_description: Sends a request to the issuer so they can inform the shopper about the upcoming recurring payment. This endpoint is used only for local acquiring in India. For more information, refer to [Recurring card payments in India](https://docs.adyen.com/payment-methods/cards/cards-recurring-india).
data.description_suggestion: Sends a request to the card issuer to notify the shopper about an upcoming recurring payment. This operation is specific to local acquiring in India and requires a NotifyShopperRequest containing shopper and payment details. Returns a NotifyShopperResult with the notification status and issuer response. Used to ensure shopper awareness of recurring transactions as required by Indian payment regulations.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks input/output schema details and doesn't clearly explain what the operation returns or its regulatory context. Added clarity about the request schema (NotifyShopperRequest), response schema (NotifyShopperResult), and the regulatory purpose (Indian payment requirements). This helps AI agents understand the geographic and regulatory constraints of this operation.

message: Operation 'post-scheduleAccountUpdater' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, not_actionable. The current description focuses only on input validation rules and doesn't explain the operation's purpose, what it returns, or what the Account Updater actually does. Added clarity about the operation's purpose (refresh stored payment details), the two input alternatives, the response schema, and the business value (maintaining valid tokens). This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
When making the API call, you can submit either the credit card information, or the recurring detail reference and the shopper reference:
 * If the card information is provided, all the sub-fields for `card` are mandatory.
 * If the recurring detail reference is provided, the fields for `shopperReference` and `selectedRecurringDetailReference` are mandatory.
data.description_suggestion: Schedules the Account Updater service to refresh stored payment details. Accepts a ScheduleAccountUpdaterRequest with either: (1) full card information with all required sub-fields, or (2) shopperReference and selectedRecurringDetailReference. Returns a ScheduleAccountUpdaterResult with the scheduling status and reference. The Account Updater will attempt to refresh card details (expiry date, etc.) from the card issuer to maintain valid recurring payment tokens.
data.reasoning: The current description focuses only on input validation rules and doesn't explain the operation's purpose, what it returns, or what the Account Updater actually does. Added clarity about the operation's purpose (refresh stored payment details), the two input alternatives, the response schema, and the business value (maintaining valid tokens). This enables AI agents to understand when to use this operation and what to expect.
